Rohan V Deshpande

About Me

Rohan Deshpande is a Junior at East Chapel Hill High School, North Carolina. He has participated in Science competitions and Eco challenges since sixth grade and has received national and international recognition in several of them. His goal is to pursue a career in technology, engineering, science, and entrepreneurship with a focus on developing innovative solutions for solving world’s pressing problems such as sustainable energy. Over the course of four years, he has developed an autonomous aerial medical response system, invented an automatic IOT enabled lightswitch for electricity savings, and implemented a cafeteria composting and recycling initiative which saves 80% of cafeteria waste. Full descriptions of Rohan’s science research projects can be found under the “projects tab” of his website. In 2016, after presenting his project at NASA in front of a panel of judges during the Conrad Spirit of Innovation Competition, he was awarded the 2016 Conrad Power Pitch award in the Energy/Environment Category. He was also one of four students chosen to represent the United States at the Beijing Youth Science Creation Competition (BYSCC). In both his freshman and sophomore years, he was honored as INTEL International Science and Engineering Fair (ISEF) finalist. In 2015, he was selected as a finalist by the Google Science Fair. His engineering project was one of 45 projects and the only one from NC chosen by Google as “ideas that will change the world”. A full list of Rohan’s awards (science, math, and non-STEM related) can be found in the awards section of his webpage.

His idols are Bill Gates, for his philanthropic work with the Gates foundation to make this world a better place, and Elon Musk, for his pursuit of innovative new technologies in the domain of sustainable energy.In the future, he plans to pursue a career in engineering/technology and entrepreneurship with a focus on developing innovative solutions for solving world’s pressing problems such as sustainable energy.

This website was created by Rohan Deshpande from scratch. The website was made with over 1,500 lines of HTML code and 18,900 of CSS code!
